<object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/vnPaLewMaAA&hl=en_US&fs=1&"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/vnPaLewMaAA&hl=en_US&fs=1&" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="425" height="344"></embed></object>
Aloha! The Kukui Cup Competition will begin on Monday, October, 4th.
The Kukui Cup Competition Starts: September 30th
Energy Tip: Turn off the lights when you leave the room.

Who: You! The students of Hale Aloha Lehua and Hale Aloha Mokihana

What: A dorm energy competition

When: October 4th, 2010 to November 1st, 2010

Where: Hale Aloha Lehua and Hale Aloha Mokihana

Why: Green is the way to go! Plus you can win awesome prizes.

How to win:

* Energy Reduction (Team): The dorm that reduces the most energy.
* Kukui Nuts (Individual): Earn Kukui Nuts (points) by committing to energy saving practices or attending energy themed events.

Energy Reduction:

1st Place Dorm: Pizza party

Kukui Nuts:

* 1st Place Individual: iPod Nano 8GB
* 1st Place Floor: TV for the lounge

Weekly Individual: $10 Jamba Juice gift card
Energy Tip: Turn off your lights when you leave the room.

fields.title: Upcoming Events

fields.text: Wondering what a Dorm-Energy Competition is all about? Watch and read about this innovative idea.
fields.title: Dorm Energy Competition

fields.text: The purpose of a Dorm Energy competition is to promote the importance of energy conservation with students residing in dorms, engaging them in an environmentally minded competition which is held between dorms. The competition is to educate students on simple things they can do to conserve energy while increasing their energy literacy. UH Dorm Energy Competition site
fields.title: What is it?

fields.text: Get helpful information for starting your own Dorm Energy Competition from students at Duke University.
fields.title: Start your own!

fields.title: Schools Engaging in Dorm Energy

fields.text: Since Hawaii is isolated from the U.S. mainland, its energy infrastructure and consumption is very unique among the rest of the United States.  Hawaii depends heavily on fossil fuels in order to meet its energy demands.  Since the state of Hawaii are fairly new islands that are situated in the most farthest reaches of the rest of the world, Hawaii geological structure is not capable of producing its own forms of fossil fuels.  Therefore, imported petroleum from Alaska and other foreign countries contribute to 90% of our energy production.
fields.title: Energy in Hawaii

more
fields.title: Get Involved With the Community!

fields.text: Games!
fields.title: Test Your Energy Literacy

fields.text: The Kukui Cup is a competition devoted to raising energy literacy in the freshmen dorms.  Literacy is raised through various activities, events, as well as resources such as videos or articles.  Additionally the Kukui Cup is a competition between the dorms as well as individuals to see who and which dorm can save the most energy.
fields.title: What is the Kukui Cup?

fields.text: As an individual you will have the chance to win an Apple iPod Nano through various energy saving actions that you complete.  Apart from the individual, each floor has a chance to win a TV for their lounge.  Also weekly prizes will be given to those who earn the most Kukui Nuts.
fields.title: Why should you compete?

fields.text:
As Individuals:

* Win Kukui Nuts by performing energy saving actions and attending events.

As a dorm floor/dorm:

* Come together as a floor and a dorm to save as much energy as you can to win over other towers.
fields.title: How to compete?

fields.text: This website provides resources to support energy literacy in the UH dormitories.  Energy literacy involves knowledge, attitudes, and behaviors.  We believe that by providing resources for learning, we can improve the literacy of students.
fields.title: About the Manoa Dorm Energy Website

fields.text:
The Kukui Cup is a dorm energy competition aimed at reducing the electricity used in the dorms and improving the energy literacy of the students.  The next Kukui Cup will be held between October 4th, 2010 and November 1st, 2010 and the two dorms competing will be Hale Aloha Lehua and Hale Aloha Mokihana.

The winners will be decided in two ways:

* Energy Reduction (Team): The dorm that reduces the most energy.
* Kukui Nuts (Individual): Earn Kukui Nuts (points) by committing to energy saving practices or attending energy themed events.

The prizes are:

* 1st Place Dorm (Energy Reduction): Pizza party
* 1st Place Individual (Kukui Nuts): iPod Nano 8GB
* 1st Place Floor (Kukui Nuts): TV for the lounge
* Weekly Individual (Kukui Nuts): $10 Jamba Juice gift card
fields.title: About the Kukui Cup Competition
